lines: Do not judge me by my success, judge me by how many times I fell down and got back up again.
author: Nelson Mandela

lines: Don’t let a bad day trick you into thinking you have a bad life.
author: Allie Newman

lines: Hardships often prepare ordinary people for an extraordinary destiny.
author: C.S. Lewis

lines: Sometimes, carrying on, just carrying on, is the superhuman achievement.
author: Albert Camus

lines: Life doesn’t get easier or more forgiving, we get stronger and more resilient.
author: Steve Maraboli

lines: Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap, but by the seeds that you plant.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

lines: We cannot always build the future for our youth, but we can build our youth for the future.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

lines: Chance favors the prepared mind.
author: Louis Pasteur

lines: Give me six hours to chop down a tree, and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe.
author: Abraham Lincoln

lines: It’s better to look ahead and prepare, than to look back and regret.
author: Jackie Joyner-Kersee

lines: There are no problems we cannot solve together, and very few that we can solve by ourselves.
author: Lyndon B. Johnson

lines: We do not inherit the earth from our ancestors; we borrow it from our children.
author: Native American Proverb

lines: We say 'things will turn out', but no. It's what we do that actually creates the future.
author: Mae Jemison

lines: When one tugs at a single thing in nature, one finds it attached to the rest of the world.
author: John Muir

lines: Let us develop respect for all living things. Let us try to replace violence and intolerance with understanding, compassion and love.
author: Jane Goodall

lines: I took a walk in the woods and came out taller than the trees.
author: Henry David Thoreau

lines: Nature is painting for us, day after day, pictures of infinite beauty.
author: John Ruskin

lines: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
author: Lao Tzu

lines: The earth has music for those who listen.
author: George Santayana

lines: To walk into nature is to witness a thousand miracles.
author: Mary Davis

lines: Never bend your head. Always hold it high. Look the world straight in the eye.
author: Helen Keller

lines: It takes courage for people to listen to their own goodness and act on it.
author: Pablo Casals

lines: You’ll never do a whole lot unless you’re brave enough to try.
author: Dolly Parton

lines: You can choose courage, or you can choose comfort, but you cannot choose both.
author: Brené Brown

lines: Courage is not simply one of the virtues, but the form of every virtue at its testing point.
author: C.S. Lewis

lines: No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted.
author: Aesop

lines: You can always, always give something, even if it is only kindness!
author: Anne Frank

lines: Good words bring good feelings to the heart. Speak with kindness, always.
author: Rod Williams

lines: You can be rich in spirit, kindness, love and all those things that you can't put a dollar sign on.
author: Dolly Parton

lines: Kindness can become its own motive. We are made kind by being kind.
author: Eric Hoffer

lines: Don’t let anyone rob you of your imagination, creativity, or curiosity. It’s your place in the world; it’s your life. Go on and do all you can with it, and make it the life you want to live.
author: Mae Jemison

lines: You cannot discover new oceans unless you have the courage to lose sight of the shore.
author: André Gide

lines: Innovation is to imagine the future and fill in the gaps.
author: Brian Halligan
